fields.summary: Add Links in Main Page

fields.description:
JPO can currently overlay the Gantt perspective against either a timeline or a sprint.

When preparing executive reports, I want JPO to overlay the Gantt against a calander view so that it facilitates communication.

This feature and "Export to PDF" are key to facilitate communication with senior management.
fields.summary: Support for Calander View
Portfolio - Plan export the backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1502].
  {panel}

As a project manager I need to be able to set the number of assignees per story for each story to correctly project out the tentative release date and team capacity.

For some larger issues it is realistic to have 2,3, or more developers working on a task but other tasks cannot be accomplished by developers working in parallel. 

Additionally, some teams can work this way, some cannot. I'd prefer not to create a Portfolio Plan for each team only so I can configure different scheduling.

While it could be argued that a large task could be broken down into smaller tasks and set the "Maximum assignees per story" to 1 it's not always that easy when the requirements are not yet detailed to break down and/or you simply need to project across multiple future releases.  This allows us to justify hiring early enough to onboard, and get up to speed in time.
fields.summary: Support Per Issue/Subtask "Maximum assignees per story"

fields.description:
As an IT manager, I want to see upcoming work over periods of time that don't always match the default time ranges.

I would like to see an increased number of "Scheduled Range" options.

For example:
 * Allow a user to select both "This Quarter" AND "Next Quarter" at the same time.
 ** Consider adding "Next N Quarters" where "N" is an integer.
 * Allow a sliding range. e.g. "From Monday of this week, until Friday 24 weeks from now".
 * Allow setting the beginning of the time range to "Start of the current sprint"
fields.summary: Increase number of "Scheduled Range" options

fields.description:
Currently, there's no synchronisation for Epic between Jira Portfolio plan and Jira Software board.

As an admin, I would like to have this feature to ensure consistency and reduce the time for performing the ranking twice - in Jira Portfolio and Jira Software.
fields.summary: Sync Epic in JPO with the rank in Jira Software boards
Availability of team members
I want to show Scope part on whole screen
Ability to use Portfolio Teams as a Field
Update Documentation on Restricted User permission

fields.description:
_As a programme manager_

_I want epic story points summation behaviour to meaningfully reflect both epic-level and user story-level points estimation in roadmap planning_

_So that the size of the epic isn't inflated in my roadmap plan as it is broken down into user stories_

*Acceptance Criteria*
 # A configuration option to replace the current epic summation behaviour with the following:
 ** the total story points estimate for an epic used in scheduling is the greater of:
 ### the summation of the story points of all open user stories in the epic OR
 ### the story points attached to the epic itself

*Problem Definition*
 Our engineering teams adopt an iterative backlog refinement process. For future releases we plan around epic-level estimation (the teams provide t-shirt sizes, which we convert to story points). The teams also aim to break the next two sprints-worth (4 weeks) of epics into user stories, each of which they then estimate. Occasionally plans change and these broken-down epics are pushed back to a later sprint. We therefore have a mix of estimated and unestimated epics and user stories on our product backlogs at any given time.

When planning the roadmap using Portfolio, the current epic points summation behaviour (i.e. epic-level points + Σ(user story points)) means that the size of epics appears to increase as they are broken down into user stories. The only way to avoid this would be to delete the epic-level estimate once all its child user stories have been created and estimated. However, planning often happens mid-way through the break-down process, so this isn't very practical.

I would like a solution that takes account of our refinement process without requiring manual intervention in Portfolio to "massage" the figures. Hence my suggestion of: MAX(epic-level points, Σ(user story points))
fields.summary: Alternative option for epic-level points summation behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1351].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we are have dependencies when the completion of Epic/Story it would start the other Epic/Story however we do not have a delay configuration for it, example:
{quote}
We are planning a project, where we order from a 3rd party supplier (for example) an internet connection. We know from this point where we order the internet-connection till that one getting delivered it will take around 1 week. In this time-frame we don't need to reserve any resources or something, because we just need simply to wait. 

For this I would like to say, that between these 2 stories in portfolio:  
- "Order an Internet-connection" and 
- "Delivery and testing of an Internet-Connection"
I want to put dependencies where I say that "Delivery and testing of an Internet-Connection" can only start when "Order an Internet-connection" has been finished 7 days ago. 

This not only work for "Internet connection", could also be that we need to order any other 3rd party support. 
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Maybe we can have a configuration to set the delay such as number of days before the start of another Epic/Story.
fields.summary: Dependencies between story/epics with delay
"Actual" chart in Theme report should account for issue resolution

fields.description:
As a Portfolio user, I want to the details of the changes made before committing the changes.

For example, it will only tell you a change was made in a board ABC, but it will not tell you what exactly did it change like velocity team was changed from 0 to 30.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to the details of the changes made before committing the changes
Theme Filter of "None" Would be Useful

fields.description:
Portfolio tries scheduling the ranked higher issues to the release with the closest start date. If the later release starts before this release, issues on later release will start before the ranked higher ones.

I'd like that portfolio schedule the issues to the closest start date available and not the closest release available.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like that Portfolio schedule my issues to the closest start date available and not the closest release available.
Allow a lock on plans to prevent recalculations

fields.description: It would be great if we can add filters for custom fields added to the Portfolio plans
fields.summary: Allow to add filter by custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1189].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no reporting for releases that are overbooked. [Overbooked releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/High-level+planning#High-levelplanning-Reconfiguringanoverbookedreleases] are those that turned to red colour.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a report on what's the state of resources and etc. on an overbooked releases together with different ways to address such a scenario, as per [Addressing bottlenecks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/High-level+planning#High-levelplanning-Addressingbottlenecks].
fields.summary: Report for overbook releases
Videos/Info for Portfolio Kanban Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the permission *Portfolio User* will grant the user ability to create, view and edit plans. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a separate permission for Create and Edit plans so that the administrators can better manage their Portfolio Plans.
fields.summary: Have a separate permission for Create and Edit Portfolio Plans
Customize Sprint Name
Create issue links when you relate issues in live plans

fields.description:
It would be great to have the same option which was released to serve in 2.11 Release available in Cloud.

To quickly pull up parent or child issue of an issue via JQL and search issues within Portfolio hierarchy. 

+*EXAMPLE:*+
h5. For parent issues of an issue
 * For parent issues of an issue in a specific hierarchy level in Portfolio for Jira, type *issuekey in parentIssuesOf("EX-000")*.
 * For instance, you have this hierarchy:
 ** INIT-001 (at _initiative_ hierarchy level)
 *** EPIC-001 (at _epic_ hierarchy level)
 *** EPIC-002

 **** STORY-001 (at _story_ hierarchy level)
 **** STORY-002
 * To get the parent issues of STORY-001, type *issuekey in parentIssuesOf("STORY-001**")*. All parent issues above STORY-001 will be returned, and not just the immediate parent issue at the epic hierarchy level. This means EPIC-002 and INIT-001 will be returned.

h5. For child issues of an issue
 * For child issues of an issue from a specific hierarchy level in Portfolio for Jira, type *issuekey in childIssuesOf("EX-000")*.
 * For instance, you have this hierarchy:
 ** INIT-001 (at _initiative_ hierarchy level)
 *** EPIC-001 (at _epic_ hierarchy level)
 *** EPIC-002

 **** STORY-001 (at _story_ hierarchy level)
 **** STORY-002To get the child issues of INIT-001, type *issuekey in childIssuesOf("INIT-001**")*. All child issues below INIT-001 will be returned, and not just the child issues at the epic hierarchy level. This means EPIC-001, EPIC-002, STORY-001, and STORY-002 will be returned. 

+*Release link:*+

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/searching-for-issues-using-portfolio-details-940678957.htmlhttps://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-2-11-release-notes-942855170.html#PortfolioforJira2.11releasenotes-parentissues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-2-11-release-notes-942855170.html#PortfolioforJira2.11releasenotes-parentissues]
fields.summary: Quickly pull up parent or child issues of an issue via JQL and search issues within Portfolio hierarchy in Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1807].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

There is no way to see history of plan changes. (I meant *committed* changes.)
In some use case, users want to look back the previous plans.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nicer if there is history function (or something like that) to look back the previous plans even after committing plan changes.
fields.summary: History of plan changes
Implement option to Import / Export on Live Plans

fields.description:
As a Portfolio for Jira user, I want to have a way to retrieve deleted plans.

h4. Why is it important?

Although there are mechanisms to avoid accidental deletion of a plan, sometimes a plan is deleted by some user and another would like to keep this plan.

In this case, the possibility to retrieve data from deleted plans would be helpful.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio for Jira user, I want to have a way to retrieve deleted plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1713].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While viewing a Portfolio Plan in the Epic View mode, new Stories can only be created if the user hovers their mouse between the parent and the child item and clicks on the green bar
!CreateStoryinEpicView.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Similar to what is shown in Story View, include a link for "+ Create Story" while in the Epic View
 
h3. Workaround 
- Create Stories using the Story View and then later map them to the Epic
fields.summary: Include a More Intuitive Way to Create New Stories While in Epic View Mode of a Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
When a new JIRA project is added to a plan in Portfolio it would be nice to be able to add that plan's cross-project releases to the new project.

At the moment the only way to do this is to delete the cross-project release and recreate it. This destroys the release across all the projects and removes it from any issues it was attached to, considerable time is required to then reattach those issues to the new cross-project release.

We have a large number of projects in JIRA and it's more managable to add them to a plan one-by-one, however this is impractical if projects have to be in a plan before cross-project releases are created.
fields.summary: Adding projects to a cross-project release in a plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1610].
  {panel}

h3. Existing Behavior
Currently the project key is shown to the left of the swimlane. If the project key is more than three characters only the first two characters will shown. 
* Example: The project key "LONGNAME" will appear as "LO..." 

 !Screen Shot 2016-09-12 at 4.42.59 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Behavior
It should be easier to tell which project the swimlane is referring to. This could be being able to change the size of the left bar, showing more characters, or perhaps by being able to hover over the abbreviated key to view the full key and project name.
fields.summary: Make it easier to tell which project a timeline swimlane project key is referring to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1671].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is an upper limit of 100 Project and 5000 open issues per plan due to performance restriction. 


!image-2016-10-14-14-16-33-277.png!

 

h3. Suggested Solution

We want to make this more scalable and allowing more project and issues per plan to support larger clients.
 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Increase the project and issue limit in Plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* In order to stay organized it would help if the rows were color-coded based on which team has been assigned to an issue

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow teams to be assigned a color/label so that all

h3. Why this is important
* In plans where there are many issues, it can be difficult to get a representation of which teams are working on which issues 
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Color code(label) rows by team

fields.description:
In Jira Portfolio, when exporting from the Scope Report, the UI shows a 'Source' column but it's not included in the exported CSV file.

!image-2019-01-29-11-55-02-163.png!
fields.summary: Export Jira Portfolio Scope Report - Include 'Source' column when Exporting to CSV

fields.description: We need help to explain some functionality about usage of portfolio. We met with platinum level consultant (Coyote Creek), but was unable to address some additional information needed.
fields.summary: Need a product manager to review some functionality on Portfolio
Portfolio Timeline Roadmap by Releases across Projects Plus Print/Share
Team field can be confused with Tempo Team field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If customer have sprints with different duration or a planned time off between sprints this is not reflected on plan for future sprints.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users settings dates for sprints on the plan.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow users settings dates for sprints on the plan.
The Parent Link field is slow on large instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1455].
  {panel}

I would like to plan, review capacity, and keep in sync with JIRA issues through portfolio in a way that does not cause headaches for the rest of the team.

What I would picture as a feature, would be the capability to assign a team to an epic/issue in Portfolio, but create a Portfolio configuration setting to leave an issue unassigned if the issue is currently unassigned.  The portfolio could still forecast capacities based on team member hours and skills.  

In the classic portfolio, I was able to accomplish this by creating a fake team member with the same number of hours available as the real team members combined.  I would then assign the "unassigned" user to all epics and stories that were still in the planning process.  I was effectively doubling my teams capacity in the eyes of Portfolio, so for the trick to work, I had to make sure to assign all issues manually to team members (real or unassigned) so I could maintain control over capacity.

I would like to have the ability to manage my capacities, while not yet being certain which developers would do the work.  My biggest headache is having portfolio assign team members to issues, having my updates and improvements on those issues slam their dashboards and emails, and knowing that the issue may not actually be assigned to them.
fields.summary: As a product manager, I want to be able to keep backlog issues unassigned while still taking in account my teams capacity, so that developers do not get confusing updates and emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1561].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently users that are not logged in can't view plans 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if users that were not logged in such as customers could view plans
fields.summary: Allow Anonymous Viewer Access For Plans

fields.description:
Portfolio allows to extend the hierarchy in JIRA. At the moment, JIRA by default has a quick create button on Epics. 

 !epic quick.png|thumbnail! 

It would be good to have the same quick create option in the child section generated by Portfolio hierarchy. 

 !child quick .png|thumbnail! 

At the moment, the best way to build the hierarchy of issues is only from within Portfolio. 

 !portfolio.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow quick create option in the child issues section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1550].
  {panel}

When you forecast different things and you commit (commit is a strong word, you engage yourself, it's not only pushing data to jira), you validate something. When you're happy from a specific forecast if you commit, you are waiting for your commit to be translated to something.

Therefore, the commit dialog should show calculated sprints and allow pushing these calculated values to JIRA. These calculated values will then be set and not change when re-calculating.

We should then have the ability to reset sprints on issues to allow them to be calculated again. This could be done via the sprint flyout on the timeline.

(this issue was originally raised in JPO-1542)
fields.summary: Allow committing calculated sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1433].
  {panel}

As a user, I would like to see stories in the Live Plan timeline, regardless of whether they have been formally estimated, so I can have a plan going forward.

A couple of ways to accomplish this:

# Put a toggle in the configuration screen to show un-estimated stories in the timeline view
# Add an option for Default Estimate in the configuration screen that un-estimated stories can use. This is in place in the standard plans today
# Put a filter in the Review and commit changes dialog to easily filter out changes to Story Points
fields.summary: Show un-estimated stories in Live Plan timeline (through default estimate or option to always show)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1775].
  {panel}

h5. Problem

Currently when JQL searching with the "Team" field, it only recognizes the team ID values. When using the actual Team names, no results are returned.
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a shared team in JPO (i.e. red)
 # Create a plan with issues and assign issues to the "red" team
 # Commit the changes
 # Now do an issue navigator search for:
{code:java}
team = red{code}
* note that no results are returned
 # Now do an issue navigator search for the ID, let's say the ID is "1":
{code:java}
team = 1{code}
* note that results show the issues assigned to the team

Extra Checks:

Database confirms that the "red" team ID is 1:
{code:java}
jira724=# select * from "AO_82B313_TEAM";
AVATAR_URL | ID | SHAREABLE | TITLE
--------------------------------------------------+----+-----------+----------------
| 1 | t | red
| 2 | t | blue
/secure/projectavatar?size=medium&avatarId=10324 | 3 | f | SSP board Team
(3 rows){code}
h5. Expected Behaviour

JQL searches recognize both the team ID and team name as search parameters.
h5. Actual Behaviour

JQL search only recognizes the team ID as a parameter
fields.summary: JQL Search for Team does not Recognize Team Names
Consider number of already completed sprints for teams connected to board issue sources

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now Portfolio plans give general errors for very specific team assignment inconsistencies.

h3. Suggested Solution

- Add the ability to determine whether to match assignees to teams on a team by team basis so that customers can avoid assignee conflicts on teams that are created as placeholders for external work.
-  Make Portfolio's plans capable of prompting customers when an assignee on an issue is not present in a team within their plan and allow them to choose to add that person to the team.

h3. Why this is important

# This would be important for teams that need to work together in stories from the same Epic.
# This is important so that customers can update their teams appropriately to avoid assignee conflicts.
fields.summary: Enhance team assignment constraints

fields.description:
Since Portfolios users are not just IT people, they might contain users, business people, non-IT guys, using commit, uncommit, revert are too GIT word. I would suggest to change them as below.

Uncommitted changes = Unsaved changes

Revert changes = Discard changes

Commit = Save.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes, Revert changes are too IT words

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have Parent/Child issues using a Custom Portfolio Hierarchy do not see the same visual formatting applied to issues that have been resolved

!LinkedvChild.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Match Visual Strikethrough formatting that is applied to issues linked when an Issue is closed:
This can also be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1661 to bring in Child Status details on the Parent Issue 

h3. Why this is important
Visually, when an issue is struck through, we can quickly see that the issue is resolved, however as there is no visual formatting nor status indicator, Customers would need to click through to see the status of the Child Issue
 
h3. Workaround 
Link Child Issues to their Hierarchal Parent
fields.summary: Child Issues Should Appear Strikethrough on Parent
Allow to "Lock" a release so that issues can no longer be calculated to it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1824].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Theme report in Jira Portfolio Plan, the *Actual* work completed is based on the work log. The customer would like to see this based on issues completed (without logging work to it)

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a report which would consider work as completed when it is Resolved
 
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Add Report similar to the Theme Report, but where Actual work is based on completed issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-543].
  {panel}

We have too many stories and usually these stories are created time by time. We want to mantain on portfolio only epic (and actually this is working) and track progress at story level.
The main problem here is that during "update from date" procedure, the progress is calculated adding time spent connected to epic and remaining estimate.
We want to give the user (portfolio edit permission) the capability to decide how progress is tracked, not only with time tracking but with 2 more setting like:
* sum time tracked
* sum remaining estimate.

this can help solve different situation that we are facind in different project and application of portfolio
fields.summary: Track progress without remaining estimate
Detach Portfolio license model from default user tier license model

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1830].
  {panel}

In the configuration settings there is the option to turn 'Dependency Scheduling' off.
The description says that by doing so means "dependencies are highlighted but don't impact the schedule".

This is not the case, however, as the plan will still not schedule items based on their dependencies i.e. if there's a cyclic dependency, or if a dependent ticket cannot be scheduled for whatever reason.
By setting the 'Dependency Scheduling' option to 'Off' you should still get warnings about the dependencies a ticket may have, but it should not impact the schedule.
fields.summary: With dependency scheduling OFF warnings/errors should not impact scheduling
Allow default team assignments for unestimated issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1545].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Right now, it isn't possible to change to logo of a team. Team logos are only set when creating a plan. This is done by finding the logo of the JIRA project that an issue source refers to.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the possibility to change the Team logo after creating a plan.
fields.summary: Add option to change the Team logo after creating a plan
Dependencies to be viewed when filtering on a single release
Have Live Plans consider 'Remaining Estimate' in Sprint Planning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1746].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you assign a member to one or more teams, and the capacity they have for work is fixed to that team. The problem occurs when there is no work for them to do on one of their teams, but that extra capacity is "wasted" because Portfolio does not recognize this capacity could go to the work he does on other teams.

A concrete example of the problem occurs in this situation:
* Member 'Dan'
* Team A and Team B
* Dan is a member of both Team A and B, with a capacity for 100pts a week in each
* Team A is associated with Board A
* Team B is associated with Board B
* There is no work that can be assigned to Board A for Dan, thus his free capacity for work is still 100pts for Team A
* There is a lot of work assigned to Dan from Board B, all 100pts of his Team B capacity is used up
* The free capacity from Board A is not recognized as capacity available for Dan in Team B, bringing his actual capacity to 200pts

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Portfolio to recognized capacity available for a team member dynamically within few Teams.
fields.summary: Allow capacity for a team member to be recognized dynamically between few Teams
Schedule view per week, month and quarter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1340].
  {panel}

Currently, the status filter allows to filter for either
* Open issues
* Open and completed issues

As a user I might want to filter for only completed issues as well, e.g., for reporting purposes. Ideally, the filter would allow to search for
* Open
* In progress
* Done
issues individually, so it would be a _status category_ filter.
fields.summary: Extend status filter to allow searching for only completed issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1515].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if the initiatives is not part of the board filter, you cannot view it in the live plan.

h3. Suggested Solution
Appreciate an option to see Initiatives even if they are not part of the board filter because most of the time we don't want to see them in a board, but we want to have an overview of them in the live plan to be able to plan, filter by initiative etc.
fields.summary: option to view initiative even if they are not part of the board filter
Determine dependencies across different plans
Calendar View of all absences at a team level
Themes - Sub Themes?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1592].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, on the scope view, users are able to filter by teams. Sometimes users would like to be able to track the progress by team members.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the ability to filter scope view by team member(s).
 
h3. Workaround
Make a team consisting of only that user and filtering the scope view by that team.
fields.summary: Able to filter scope view by team member(s)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1679].
  {panel}

*Story:* As a Program Manager I want to add JQL quick filters to the top of my Portfolio plan, so that I can use specific business/team logic relevant to the teams & initiatives based on the exact queries I need. 

*Details:*
* Create an admin page like the Quick Filter page under the Configuration of an Agile Board. 
* Allow for any JQL statement (exactly as the Agile Boards do) to be saved/used.
* Toggle button interface exactly as set up on Agile Boards (and competing product BigPicture), to single click and have the portfolio filter to that specific subset of data

*Problem this is solving* 
* Each company is different, and the standard portfolio filtering fields can't cover all use cases/combinations that are needed for managing the different environments & industries that could benefit from this tool
* It opens the door to filtering by custom fields, which many customers rely heavily on and use throughout Jira and Agile Boards. 
* Reduces requests to the Portfolio team for more drop down lists in addition to the existing 8 that are available. If users can create their own filters, it should reduce the additional filtering functionality that the team would have to build.
fields.summary: Quick Filter Functionality in Jira Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the releasing of a version feature is only available in the Releases Tab in the JIRA project. The customer is using a board which filters trough multiple projects and would find it helpful to have the possibility to release the version from within the Board. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to release the version from the Board
*  !Versions on Board.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add possibility to release the version from the Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1690].
  {panel}

h4. Problem

JIRA Portfolio allows very fine-grained configuration and setup of plans, making sure that customers can adapt the tool to their complex planning requirements. However, this complexity leaves room for errors and often times it is difficult to figure out what may have been misconfigured.

As an example, there are a number of possible causes why a certain issue or issues do not show up in the plan. [This Atlassian Answers thread|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38390402/issues-not-showing-up-in-portfolio-live-plans] lists a number of them.
h4. Suggestion

Following the success of the [JIRA Admin Helper|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/jira-admin-helper-802593078.html], it would be very helpful to have a {{JIRA Portfolio Helper}} that could be used to determine the answers for the questions like (but not limited to):
 * Why does _X issue_ not show up in my Portfolio plan?
 * Why is my release _red_? (Suggestions on possible solutions)
 * What else would fit in this release with fixed release date?
 * Why does my capacity report show bottleneck?
 * What changes I need to make to my existing projects _X_ and _Y_ in order to see them on the same plan? (suggest on missing releases/fix versions, large delta between teams' velocity, incompatible capacity measures)

 

Through this feature, customers could self-help and adjust issue sources accordingly, determine the logic behind specific scheduling "decisions" by the algorithm.
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio Helper
Add an Initiatives view option for line to show how epics fit into initiatives

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1531].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Portfolio put the rank into priority when scheduling the issues. This may be confusing when dependencies are included into the equation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the documentation to explain the expected behaviour when scheduling - which will be considered on priority (rank) and what will be considered in addition.
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Dependency Handling
Graphic representation of sprints within Initiative and Epics view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1881].
  {panel}

We're trying to use the advanced filter (JQL) to search for all issues that are not assigned to a particular team using the Portfolio Team field. However, it’s not returning any results. After discussing with Atlassian support, it was stated that JIRA instance is not able to use advanced filters related to Portfolio fields.

 

This is the actual query I'm using: 

cf[11400] is not (27)

cf[11400] = Team Portfolio

(27) = Team A
fields.summary: Enable ability to use advanced filters to search for JIRA Portfolio fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1814].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Missing Portfolio Java API documentations in https://docs.atlassian.com/

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the Portfolio Java API in https://docs.atlassian.com/ whenever there are Public Java API for Portfolio

h3. Why this is important
This is useful for plugin developers or administrator that would like to refer to the classes used for customisation etc.
fields.summary: Publish Portfolio for JIRA Java API

fields.description:
I don't know which dependency i'm adding because I can't read the complete user story. I have to close the popup, be sure the story has already been commited, used the EC-192 number to be sure i'm linking the correct one.

!image-2018-02-27-11-20-37-040.png!
fields.summary: portfolio Add dependecy combobox is to small

fields.description:
The _Themes report_ in Portfolio takes the data from the _Estimates_ column which futher thakes the data from the _Remaining estimate_ of the issues.

Please consider implementing an option to have the themes report take the date from the _Original estimate_ of the issues.
fields.summary: Have the Themes report also based on the original estimate
Ability to publish / share reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the *Estimate* field in Portfolio corresponds to the *Remaining Estimate* in JIRA issue

h3. Suggested Solution
Rename the Estimate field in Portfolio to Remaining Estimate
fields.summary: Rename the Estimate field in Portfolio to Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is a possibility to set dependencies on issues but not dependencies for projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add Project dependency in a Portfolio plan 
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Add Project dependency in a Portfolio plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1859].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users are not able to sort by the columns "Labels", "Themes" and "Releases on the Portfolio Scope view.

!Screen Shot 2017-03-07 at 1.55.24 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution

Make these columns sortable as the others.
fields.summary: Make the columns "Labels", "Themes" and "Releases sortable on Scope view.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1727].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we do not have a public source code for JIRA Portfolio available for customer to download.

h3. Suggested Solution
Maybe can provide the source code for certain tier of commercial purchased license of JIRA Portfolio.
fields.summary: source code for JIRA Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1442].
  {panel}

*Problem statement*
In live plans, when the source (filter, board or project) returns resolved issues, these are not currently shown in the import preview.
They are nevertheless imported, and the user can display them by setting the _More->Completion date_ to a date sufficiently far back.

This behavior is confusing as the user has no perception that a bunch of issues are available but hidden in the plan. These issues are particularly relevant if the plan is used as a monitoring tool for a JIRA initiative that was started before the creation of the plan itself (and then will reasonably have a number of resolved issues at the time of import).

*Suggestion for the improvement*
I would recommend to modify the import preview to include the full list of the issues actually imported, regardless of whether they would then be hidden (for any kind of default display setting).
Optionally, the preview may notify the user that some of these issues will be hidden (ideally detailing which ones and why).

*Expected benefit*
This improvement would give the user a full understanding of what the plan will contain and will favor a better control of the different options and usage scenario
fields.summary: Import wizard in live plans should show that completed issues are imported

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no possibility to commit the calculated values from Portfolio to JIRA

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to commit the calculated values from Portfolio to JIRA
fields.summary: Add possibility to commit the calculated values from Portfolio to JIRA
Allow for the import of Issue Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1475].
  {panel}

I'd like to be able to define a fixed width for the sprint columns at the main timeline.

Currently, I have so many sprints planned that I can't see what is happening on my timeline. 

 !timeline1.PNG|thumbnail! 

Everytime I want to view the tasks I have to change the page width to 10.000px, so the columns are wide enough for me to read the content.

 !timeline2.PNG|thumbnail! 

A option in the configuration page allowing me to chose dynamic width or fixed with for those columns would be very welcome.

* I'm using Portfolio for Jira Server.
fields.summary: Resizable timeline columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the capacity for a team member from a shared team is considered only based on the current plan. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Consider capacity for the shared team members based on all plans where this team is used

h3. Note
Currently, shared team is useful when setting the team member availability.
fields.summary: Consider capacity for the shared team members based on all plans where this team is used
Display number of people instead of member icons in Members Column

fields.description: In Portfolio capacity planner, right now the planner shows only the remaining hours instead of total capacity of a user. It would be helpful if the capacity planner shows the total capacity so that it would be easy for administrators to track the capacity of users.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to show total capacity in capacity planner instead of remaining hours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1213].
  {panel}

Portfolio allows me to filter for a time ranges, either custom or by month and quarter.

However these are not relative. When it is in the middle of the month, the data shown is only for the next two weeks. When we are close to the end of the month, it only shows a couple of days.

We are working with kanban and I'm mostly interested in the upcoming 30 days of work.

It would be nice if there are relative time filters like:
* 1 or 2 week window
* 31 day window

Currently there is only the following:

 !image-2015-12-10-12-01-35-903.png|thumbnail! 

I could work around it by using the specific range option, but this needs multiple clicks to solve.
fields.summary: Relative time filters

fields.description:
Currently, there is no clear indication or warning when excluding child issues could result in the parent being excluded from the plan as well.

It requires thorough checks on the list of changes that will be committed. Also, the changes could be committed by different users causing unwanted issue exclusions.
fields.summary: Clear indication or warning when excluding child issues could exclude the parent

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This is to workaround JPOCLOUD-7537. Setting the value on a parent level *only* can help to reduce the impact of having missing information when items in Jira Portfolio plan is filtered out.

While the field's value is set at the parent, the children should inherit the value similarly to the current behaviour. Meaning, the field is only editable at a certain level of the hierarchy.
fields.summary: Ability to set fields' value only at parent level in Jira Portfolio plan

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to see the sprint goals surfaced in portfolio so that I can quickly understand what a team is trying to accomplish in a sprint.
fields.summary: Surface Sprint Goals in Portfolio
When moving an Epic to a different Initiative, maintain the link in JIRA
See which Initiatives have stories within them that cannot be assigned, with red exclamation

fields.description:
I would like to be able to add three different values for the original estimate. A minimum value, maximum value and a most likely value (probably the one we estimate today in the original estimate field.)

Then the tool should be able to use the Three point estimation technique to give me the likelihood of completing my project within a certain time.

 

Se for example this [site|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-point_estimation] for an example.
fields.summary: Three-point estimation
As a project manager, I want to be able to mark the skills needs for an issue so that the right individual can be assigned
Feature to see a user's overall capacity (not just per plan)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Opening an Initiative from Issue View will show the associated Epics. It would be great if we have a feature to show other fields too such as Epic Status, Assignee etc.
*  !image-2018-09-07-21-29-51-016.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to show fields in Initiative under Child view panel
fields.summary: Feature to show fields in Initiative under Child view panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1524].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There isn't a clear description explaining the feature to order by columns, its limitation and how to update it back to the default of Order By Rank.

h3. Suggested Solution
Describe and provide additional visual to understand when a scope is ordered by column and when it is ordered by rank (highlighted and not)
fields.summary: Document Order By columns on Live plans

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the Issue Source used for the plan is a Filter, the plan start date is based on the first release Start Date if it is in future.
 !Relase Start date in future.png|thumbnail! 

If the release start date is in the past, the plan Start date is *Today*.  
 !Release Start date in past.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Plan Start date should show the first release Start date  when the Issue Source for the plan is a Filter even if it is in the past
fields.summary: Plan "Start Date" should be the first release Start Date when the Issue Source for the plan is a Filter even if this date is in the past

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1535].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Live plan only has the option to group the lines by _Global_ and _Project_ at the moment. As a user, I'd like more options to group them by the data sources such as board and filter.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to group the stream lines by board and filter
fields.summary: Option to group the stream line by board and filter
